name: lmod1cl
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, crg))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ LMod, c1 ∈ c2, c3 ∈ Ring)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c3, crg))
-| wi(wcel(c3, crg), wcel(c1, c2))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ LMod → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c3 ∈ Ring)
⊣ (c3 ∈ Ring → c1 ∈ c2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c3, crg))
-| wi(wcel(c3, crg), wcel(c1, c2))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ LMod → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c3 ∈ Ring)
⊣ (c3 ∈ Ring → c1 ∈ c2)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c3, crg))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(csca, c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c3, crg), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(csca, c0))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ LMod → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ (c3 ∈ Ring → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ c3 =(Scalar ` c0)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c3, crg), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c3))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cur, c3))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c3 ∈ Ring → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ c2 =(Base ` c3)
⊣ c1 =(1r ` c3)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(csca, c0))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c3))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cur, c3))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ LMod → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ c3 =(Scalar ` c0)
⊣ c2 =(Base ` c3)
⊣ c1 =(1r ` c3)

comment: The ring unit in a left module belongs to the ring base set. (Contributed by NM, 11-Jan-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-Jun-2014.)
